taskCommentDTO Data Type

This data type has been deprecated.

Represents a task comment. This class is being deprecated in v27.2 and will be removed in v29. Applications using this class should switch to using the CommentDTO class instead.

Namespace
(Default)
Properties
name data type type namespace min/max occurs description
Properties inherited from commentDTO
actionInfoDTO element 0/unbounded The list of actions available to the caller for execution.
commentDTO element 0/unbounded An array of children comment objects (these are "replies" to this comment).
commentPermsDTO element 0/1 An object that describes the current user's permissions on the comment object.
dateTime element 0/1 The date the comment was created.
int element 0/1 The comment's ID.
int element 0/1 The ID of the incident to which this comment belongs.
string element 0/1 The name of the incident to which this comment belongs.
objectHandle element 0/1 The owner of the incident to which this comment belongs.
boolean element 1/1 A flag indicating if the comment is deleted. Generally comment objects are actually removed from the database when the user deletes them. However, if the user deletes a parent comment the parent is just marked as deleted (and it's text is cleared).
objectHandle element 0/unbounded An array of user IDs who are mentioned in this comment. You mention a user in a comment by typing @User. Note that the client populates this. That is, the client will have to populate mentioned_users itself (the server does not currently parse the comment text to look for mentioned users).
dateTime element 0/1 The date the comment was modified.
modifyUserDTO element 0/1  
int element 0/1 The ID of the parent comment (null for top-level comments).
int element 0/1 The ID of the task to which this comment belongs. Will be null on incident comments.
string element 0/1 The name of the task to which this comment belongs. Will be null on task comments.
textContentDTO element 0/1 The comment text.
commentType element 0/1 The type of the comment (incident or task).
string element 0/1 The user's first name.
objectHandle element 0/1 The ID of the user who created the comment. See the fullOrgDTO (users property) for a list of possible user values.
string element 0/1 The user's last name.

Example

<taskCommentDTO>
  <id>...</id>
  <parent_id>...</parent_id>
  <user_id/>
  <user_fname>...</user_fname>
  <user_lname>...</user_lname>
  <create_date>...</create_date>
  <modify_date>...</modify_date>
  <modify_user/>
  <text/>
  <children/>
  <mentioned_users/>
  <comment_perms/>
  <is_deleted>...</is_deleted>
  <actions/>
  <inc_id>...</inc_id>
  <inc_name>...</inc_name>
  <task_id>...</task_id>
  <task_name>...</task_name>
  <type>...</type>
  <inc_owner/>
</taskCommentDTO>
